  },

parsed_response.deal_structure: The transaction is structured as a stock-for-stock merger, wherein Velocity Merger Sub, Inc., a wholly-owned subsidiary of Compass, Inc. ('Compass'), will merge with and into Anywhere Real Estate Inc. ('Anywhere'), with Anywhere surviving as a wholly-owned subsidiary of Compass. The consideration for the merger is 1.436 shares of Compass Class A common stock for each share of Anywhere common stock, with cash paid in lieu of fractional shares. The transaction is intended to qualify as a tax-free reorganization under Section 368(a) of the Internal Revenue Code【0†input.pdf】【3†input.pdf】.
parsed_response.purchase_price: The per-share consideration is 1.436 shares of Compass Class A common stock for each share of Anywhere common stock. The total equity value is not explicitly stated in the agreement, but the exchange ratio implies a value based on Compass's share price at closing【3†input.pdf】.
conditions_to_closing: Approval of the issuance of Compass shares by a majority of Compass stockholders (Company Stockholder Approval).
Adoption of the Merger Agreement by a majority of Anywhere stockholders (Anywhere Stockholder Approval).
Authorization for listing Compass shares on the NYSE.
Effectiveness of the registration statement filed with the SEC for the Compass shares to be issued in the merger.
Expiration or termination of the waiting period under the Hart-Scott-Rodino Antitrust Improvements Act of 1976.
Absence of any injunction, order, or law prohibiting the merger.
Accuracy of the parties' representations and warranties, subject to materiality standards.
Material compliance by each party with their respective obligations under the Merger Agreement【2†input.pdf】【8†input.pdf】.

termination_rights: Either party may terminate if the merger has not closed by September 22, 2026, with automatic three-month extensions (up to three times) if all closing conditions except regulatory approvals are satisfied or waived.
Termination if a final and nonappealable law or order prohibits the merger.
Termination by Compass if Anywhere stockholder approval is not obtained, or by Anywhere if Compass stockholder approval is not obtained.
Termination in the event of a material uncured breach by the other party of its representations, warranties, covenants, or agreements.

Termination by Compass if Anywhere's board changes its recommendation in favor of the merger, or by Anywhere if Compass's board changes its recommendation regarding the issuance of Compass shares【1†input.pdf】【4†input.pdf】.
termination_fees: A $200 million termination fee is payable by the terminating party under certain specified circumstances.

A $350 million reverse termination fee is payable by Compass to Anywhere if the merger is terminated because required regulatory clearances are not obtained before the Outside Date or if the merger is permanently enjoined【1†input.pdf】【4†input.pdf】.

mac_provisions.definition_scope: The agreement includes customary Material Adverse Change (MAC) or Material Adverse Effect (MAE) provisions, which allow termination if there is a material adverse change in the business, operations, or financial condition of the other party. Specific carve-outs are not detailed in the summary but typically exclude general economic conditions, industry-wide disruptions, and changes in law【2†input.pdf】.

other_material_terms.go_shop_no_shop: The agreement includes non-solicitation provisions that restrict Anywhere and Compass from seeking alternative business combination proposals. There is no explicit go-shop provision mentioned【0†input.pdf】【2†input.pdf】.
other_material_terms.financing: Compass has secured a debt financing commitment of up to $750 million in the form of a 364-day senior secured bridge loan facility to refinance existing indebtedness of Anywhere and pay related fees and expenses【7†input.pdf】.
other_material_terms.support_agreements: Key stockholders of Compass (holding ~29.6% of voting power) and Anywhere (holding ~8.7% of Anywhere common stock) have entered into voting and support agreements to vote in favor of the merger and not transfer their shares, subject to certain exceptions【6†input.pdf】【13†input.pdf】.

The approach involved identifying the transaction structure, purchase price, closing conditions, termination provisions, MAC clauses, and other material terms such as financing and support agreements. Each term was validated by cross-referencing specific sections of the agreement to ensure accuracy and completeness.
